value: Proof of Design for a Printed Textile

label: Description
value: Design of floral forms enclosing scene showing a bridge across river with boats and buildings at left. Background is stippled (picotage).

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Embroidered or Woven Border

label: Description
value: Shown are two plants of different designs united naturalistic and fnatastical forms; the right one shows blossoms in bell and in peacock feather shapes. Bottom center, a blossom and a bead on the points of segments, intended to alternate like the plants.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Embroidered Woven Fabric

label: Description
value: Rising rinceau with lave leaves and lace blossoms on top of the spirals alternating in vertical rows. They are of different designs and in opposite order in alternating rows.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Embroidered or Woven Border

label: Description
value: Fantastical plants are horizontally connected by lace festoons. Most of one plant and a part of a bough of another are shown.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A bunch of flowers with a very big fantastical blossom is shown top right; a flower bough extends from it toward left, ending with a calyx from which a plant grows. Leaves are sketched top left. Bottom center: a border of lace canopies which are connected by double fans. One unit and parts of the adjoining ones are shown. A lilac strip is beneath top center.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The decoration consists of irregularly disposed flower motifs. A big-sized and two smaller fantastical flower boughs and a calyx palmette are to be brocaded. Monochrome leaf boughs form a background decoration.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, brush and black paint on oily tracing paper

label: Dimensions
value: (Left and Top edges): 16.9 × 39.5 cm (6 5/8 × 15 9/16 in.) (Right and Bottom edges): 40.5 × 47.7 cm (15 15/16 × 18 3/4 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Fantastical flower motifs of two alternating designs are staggered in horizontal rows and connected in vertical rows by stems with many side branches. Undulated zig-zags connect small-sized leaf motifs which form alternatively with a lattice motif and a flower bunch, on the main stems, horizontal rows between the main rows. White stripes laterally.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouche, brush and black paint on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: An undulated stem with many side branches rises in the right center. Parts of it are crossed by fantastical flower boughs which alternate in horizontal and vertical rows. Shown are: a bough with a leaf and a blossom and bough with many leaves and several blossoms and with a lace panel with a lattice gree, top row, and in an opposite direction in the bottom row; besides a bough with a leaf and a leaf blossom. Laterally are white, and outside black stripes.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouche, brush and black paint on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Boughs connect six fantastical flower motifs, which are disposed in two horizontal rows. A flower bunch grows from a big shell, bottom left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouche on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Top row, at left: a flower bunch rising from a small shell, the point of which serves as support of chain festoons. At right, two ribbon festoons and a flower bough. Bottom row, at left: a small flower bough; at right: a big fantastical plant. The decoartion is intended to be repeated in opposite direction in alternate horizontal units.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, brush and black paint on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Painted Decoration of a Ceiling

label: Description
value: Divided into four squares with inner circles, three dividing those into a band and a central circle. That above at left has inside a pan flute and outside a vine garland; that above at right has a similar garland and inside two hats and a ribbon. Below at left are outside two laurel branches, inside a Medusa head. Below at right is a satyr mask in the center of laurel branches.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and dark ink, brush and watercolor, silverweight heightening on light green-gray paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1909; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Emrboidered or Woven Horizontal Border

label: Description
value: A fantastical plant with lace blossoms and a rising spiral with a lace blossom are connected by festoons of lace ribbon. They are intended to alternate. A border composed of a beige and white stripe and a row consisting of two lace heart forms and leave bough, of which two unites are shown, is at bottom left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white, beige gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Corner Motif

label: Description
value: A lace cloth suspended from blossom rosettes fills the corner obliquely. Parts of a flower bough stick through vertical stripes of the cloth. A triangular crest border forms the corner.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white, beige, yellow and black gouche on oily tracing paper; on verso: white netting

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Two obliquely shown leaf boughs are of opposite directions in alternate horizontal rows. Rising undulated stems, which are fastened together by bowknots, connect the boughs in vertical rows. White stripes, laterally.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for an Embroidered Woven Fabric

label: Description
value: Fantastical cones with great calyx form rows; they are connected in vertical rows by undulated stems, of which a side stem forms a part of a plant, which are disposed in staggered rows, which alternate with those of the cones. one cone showed the coloring, another and parts of two more being outlined.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Project for a Pile Carpet (or Textile)

label: Description
value: A wheel-like ornament on black ground; one half is shown. Low palmettes and higher plant palmettes grow alternately from a rosette in the center.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Pile Carpet (or Textile)

label: Description
value: A triangular ornament on black ground; one half is shown. A plant palmette in lozenge. Two blossom rosettes are shown beside, and nearer to the upper and lower points.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Plants grow horizontally beside the lateral points of a lozenge containing two spade leaves and two calyxes growing from a bead.  Motif is to alternate with another consisting of four calyxes surrounding a bead. Heart motifs grow from the upper and lower calyxes. Upper and lower framing stripes, one with row of beads.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A metal pole rises from a calyx which is supported by two acanthus spirals. The pole is surrounded by rings. Leaves and two ears of grain grow from it in the lwoer part. A vine wreath is applied by rosettes to the upper part, a big rosette in the center of the wreath.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and yellow, beige, green, lilac, rose, and red paint on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Circles composed of bead chains cross each other so to form spherical octagons staggered in alternate rows. Eight-pointed rosettes are shown in them. Black ground. One half, and two quarters of octagons are shown.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and blue, green, yellow, cream, and brownish black paint on paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Decoration of a Frieze

label: Description
value: The right side is shown. The central motif is the mask of a woman above leaves, and with a diadem of leaves, carrying upon the head a basket with flowers and grapes. An acanthus rinceau springs from the lower leaves. A lioness springs to catch grapes. The background is colored.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1909; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Mouldings form a half circle and a framing band of it. Half a laural wreath surrounds a black sun in the half circle. a zigzag thread hands on beads from the upper moulding. In the framing band alternate white and grey oblongs, the latter ones showing an ornamentation. A plan hangs in the wedges. Mouldings, including a bead moulding, are on top.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and paint on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

value: Brush and gouche on oily tracing paper

A border composed of segments with crescents upon the points and beads inside is at the bottom; three repeats are shown.
